children.subject: Thanks! Just for clarification I am curious about the case 2 units of A- and 2 units of B+.

I know that the Bearfacts GPA (i.e. your official GPA) computes an average of your grades weighted by the number of units.  So, if you took 3 units for an A- and 1 unit for a B+, the overall GPA would be $$\frac{3 \times 3.7 + 1 \times 3.3}{4} = 3.6$$.

I would assume that the major declaration form would be similar.  Since $$3.6$$ is closer to an A-, I would put down an A-.  Now if you got exactly in between an A- and a B+ (so 2 units of A- and 2 units of B+), then I'm not sure.  Either way, an instructor response is probably better.

history.content: Marking as resolved due to inactivity.

Hello

If I took 61AS over two semesters, and theoretically received an A- and B+, what would the average of these two grades be when I put them on the major declaration form? Do I round up to A- or down to B+?

Also, when the department calculates my prerequisite GPA would they calculate it as 2 units of A- and 2 units of B+ or 4 units of the average grade (either A- or B+)?
history.subject: CS61AS Grading Question
